result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Defendant Travis Lee Thomack in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Travis Lee Thomack.  Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin.  Information received.  Waive reading.  NG plea entered on each count.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Travis Lee Thomack in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Travis Lee Thomack.  Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin. PQW received/reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.
Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned plea hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Warrant has been canceled per Judge

10:40 AM  Deft. appears by video polycom from Winnebago County.  Atty Brad Hansen appears for deft.  Edward Burke appears for State of WI. Atty Hansen advised deft. failed to appear for PH, and bench warrant was issued.  Asking for bench warrant to be quashed so deft. can go into inpatient treatment.  Court agrees to quash warrant.  Current address given to court.  Present bond continues.
Motion hearing on June 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Atty Hansen in the office and Jordan/DA's office by phone - scheduled MH Quash Warrant by video conference on 6/10/2022 at 10:45am. I sent NOH to Clerk of Courts office to set up video conference for Winnebago County Jail.
9:34 AM Defendant Travis Lee Thomack not in court.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Travis Lee Thomack.  BWA.
Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Phone call from Atty Hansen and Debbie/DA's office rescheduled the PH that was set on 4/8/2022 at 9:30am to 4/29/2022 at 9:30am, this was rescheduled at the request of the DA's office the officer is not available.

w/condition   Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.  Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
